text: hi guys it's angel today I'm going to
show you how to make Tomeo ping which
are green onion pancakes
but not just any green onion pancakes
I'm going to show you how to make super
flaky green onion pancakes using some
tips and tricks so with that let's get
cooking for this recipe we'll need 2
cups of all-purpose flour
now flour does expire so make sure
you're using a fresh batch otherwise
your pancakes will taste stale
we'll also need 4 to 5 stalks of green
onions and Tomio being is typically made
from the top parts of the green onions
but today I'm going to use the full
stock because I like the bottom parts
too we'll also need 1 teaspoon of kosher
salt 3/4 of a cup of boiling water and
finally I have here some sea salt flakes
which will be a nice finishing salt and
also a salt to layer in between the
pancakes which will give us this nice
savory taste when we bite into them
we'll also need some vegetable oil too
first in a large mixing bowl add your
all-purpose flour and your kosher salt
give that a good mix to mix all the dry
ingredients first then we want to add
our hot water a little bit at a time
slowly fold that in great so once
everything has been pretty much mixed in
we are ready to start kneading spread
your dough out on a clean lightly
floured surface and make sure to use a
little flour
your hands so it doesn't stick knead the
dough for five to eight minutes or until
smooth and shiny it's a good workout
when you're done kneading roll the dough
into a ball and let it sit on the
counter top covered with some damp paper
towels or kitchen towel and let it sit
covered for at least thirty minutes
during about thirty minutes we're going
to let the dough rest before we roll it
out while we're waiting we can go ahead
and cut up our green onions if you'd
like you can serve your green onion
pancakes with some sauce I've got a
little bit of soy sauce with some black
vinegar mixed in with some sliced red
chilies
now we'll go ahead and divide the dough
into three pieces
set two pieces aside and let's start
rolling out the dough using one of the
three pieces begin by flattening with
the palm of your hand then with the
floured rolling pin gently roll your
dough out make it as thin as possible
aiming for almost paper like now here's
the tip for getting flaky layers use my
three hand measurement guide this is
where you roll the dough out so thin you
can put three of your hands side-by-side
to fit on the dough one two three easy
see
next brush a light coating of vegetable
oil sprinkle some green onions add a
little bit of sea salt flakes and then
carefully roll into a log shape when
you're done roll into a cinnamon bun and
with the ends well just tuck them
underneath then set them aside and let
them rest for another 10 minutes okay we
will take one pancake just flatten it
gently with our hands first we'll want
to gently roll this pancake out now
there are going to be some air bubbles
so try and work around those if you can
if the air bubbles pop or the greeny
onions come out that's fine as well
we're aiming for two hand widths so we
don't need to roll it out as big as we
had before when you roll it out try to
make sure it's in a circle shape this
time
so hand with one - perfect
since I'm only eating two today I am
going to freeze my last pancake I
thought some parchment paper here I'm
just going to freeze the pancake between
two layers of parchment paper and when I
want to cook it next time I'll just take
it out of the freezer let it defrost
maybe for about two to three minutes and
then go ahead and put it on the stove
just like that now it's time to cook
preheat a nonstick pan on medium heat
and brush with a bit of oil then add our
pancake Brown each side of the pancake
for one to two minutes before flipping
then continue to flip and rotate for a
total cooking time of six to eight
minutes or until done feel free to brush
more oil in between flips as needed
nearing the end
squeeze your pancake together to create
texture and help fluff up those layers
when you're done everything should be
nice and crisp transfer to a plate to
cool slightly before cutting into pieces
and serving hot can you guys hear how
flaky that is
this is how you make leaky green onion
pancakes they smell really good right
now and I wanted you to hear how flaky
they are you hear that they were super
flaky I'm going to do a taste test I can
taste the salt the flaky salts that we
put in there very savory
very nice super yummy Lakey I hope you
try it and let me know how you like it
in the comments below I will see you
guys next time bye
